{{Unreferenced|date=July 2011}} {{Infobox Instrument |color1=#FFD700 |color2=#FFEC8B |name=Flute |names=Transverse flute, [[Theobald Boehm|Boehm]] flute, C flute |image=Flute.jpg |classification= *[[Woodwind]] *[[Wind instrument|Wind]] *[[Aerophone]] |range=[[Image:Range flute.png|130px|center]] |midi=073/074 (Flute) }}
In music, a '''''Flute method''''' is a kind of specific [[textbook]] style manual for playing the [[Western concert flute|flute]]. It usually contains [[Fingering (music)|fingering]] charts and/or [[musical scale|scales]] and numerous different [[exercise]]s, sometimes also simple [[etude]]s, in different [[key (music)|key]]s, in ascending order as to difficulty (= in methodical ''progression'') or with a focus on isolated aspects like fluency, [[rhythm]], [[dynamics (music)|dynamics]], [[articulation (music)|articulation]] and the like. Sometimes there are duets or even [[recital]] pieces, also with accompaniment. Such methods differ from etude books in that they are meant as a linear course for a student to follow, with consistent guidance, whereas volumes of etudes are not as comprehensive.
As typical instrumental methods are meant to function as textbooks supporting an instrumental teacher (rather than to facilitate self-teaching), usually no basic or special playing techniques are covered in any depth. Detailed instructions in this respect are only found in special, [[Autodidacticism|autodidactical]] methods.
Some methods are specially tailored for students on certain [[skill]] levels or [[Erikson's stages of psychosocial development|stages of psychosocial development]]. In contrast, a 'complete' method (sometimes in multiple volumes) is meant to accompany the student until he or she becomes an advanced player.
Methods of certain authors or editors have achieved the status of standard works (reflecting regional and cultural differences) and are published or reissued by different [[publishing]] companies and often in new layouts or [[arrangement]]s. The [[Suzuki Method]] is one of the most well known examples of this.
The following is a list of various methods of historical interest.
==Historical== ===17th Century=== * [[John Playford|Playford, John]], [http://imslp.org/wiki/The_Delightful_Companion_(Playford,_John) ''The Delightful Companion or Choice new Lessons for The Recorder or Flute'']
===18th Century=== * [[Michel Corrette|Corrette, Michel]], [http://imslp.org/wiki/M%C3%A9thode_pour_apprendre_%C3%A0_jou%C3%ABr_la_fl%C3%BBtte_(Corrette,_Michel) Méthode raisonnée pour apprendre aisément à jouër de la Flûtte Traversiere (1740)] * [[Jacques Hotteterre|Hotteterre, Jacques]], [http://imslp.org/wiki/Principes_de_la_flute_traversiere,_de_la_Flute_a_Bec,_et_du_Haut-bois,_Op.1_(Hotteterre,_Jacques) ''Principes de la flute traversiere, de la Flute a Bec, et du Haut-bois'', Op.1 ([[Amsterdam]]: Estienne Roger, 1728)] * [[Antonio Lorenzoni|Lorenzoni, Antonio]], ''Saggio per ben sonare il flautotraverso con alcune notizie generali ed utili per qualunque strumento, ed altre concernenti la storia della musica'' ([[Vicenza]]: Per F. Modena, 1779) * [[William Pearson (composer)|Pearson, William]], [http://imslp.org/wiki/The_Compleat_Musick-Master_(Pearson,_William) ''The Compleat Musick-Master'' (1722)] * [[Johann Joachim Quantz|Quantz, Johann Joachim]], [http://imslp.org/wiki/On_Playing_the_Flute_%28Quantz,_Johann_Joachim%29 ''Versuch einer anweisung die flöte traversiere zu spielen.''] (1752) * [[Johann George Tromlitz|Tromlitz, Johann George]], ''Unterricht der flöte zu spielen'' (1791)
===19th Century=== * [[Henry Altes|Altes, Henry]], ''Method for the Boehm flute.'' * [[Benoit Tranquille Berbiguier|Berbiguier, Benoit Tranquille]], ''Flute method.'' * [[Rafael Dressler|Dressler, Rafael]], [http://imslp.org/wiki/New_and_complete_instructions_for_the_flute_(Dressler%2C_Raphael) ''New and complete instructions for the flute, Op. 68.''] (1827) * [[Louis Drouet|Drouet, Louis]], ''Method of flute playing.'' (1830) * [[Anton Bernhard Fürstenau|Fürstenau, Anton Bernhard]], ''Flöten-schule, Op. 42.'' (1826) * Fürstenau, Anton Bernhard, ''Die kunst des Flötenspiels, Op.138.'' (1844) * Hugot and Wunderlich, ''Méthode de flûte.'' (1804) * [[Thomas Lindsay (flutist)|Lindsay, Thomas]], ''The elements of flute-playing.'' (1830) * [[Tebaldo Monzani|Monzani, Tebaldo]], [http://imslp.org/wiki/Instructions_for_the_German_Flute_(Monzani%2C_Tebaldo) ''Instructions for the german flute.''] (1801) * [[Mathieu Peraut|Peraut, Mathieu]], ''Méthode pour la flûte.'' (1800) * [[Heinrich Soussmann|Soussmann, Heinrich]], [http://imslp.org/wiki/Grosse_praktische_Fl%C3%B6tenschule,_Op.53_(Soussmann,_Heinrich) ''Grosse praktische Flötenschule'' Op. 53 (Leipzig 1841)] * [[Ernest Wagner|Wagner, Ernest]], ''Foundation to flute playing.'' * [[Jacob Wragg|Wragg, Jacob]], [http://imslp.org/wiki/The_Flute_Preceptor,_Op.6_(Wragg,_Jacob) ''Improved_Flute_Preceptor...'' op. 6 (First Edition 1800?)]
==Modern Methods== ===Early 20th century=== * [[Leonardo De Lorenzo|De Lorenzo, Leonardo]]. ''L'Indispensabile – A complete modern school for the flute.'' (1912) * [[Paul Taffanel|Taffanel, Paul]] and [[Philippe Gaubert|Gaubert, Philippe]]. ''Methode complete de flute.'' (1923)
===Mid to Late 20th Century=== * [[Shinichi Suzuki (violinist)|Suzuki, Shinichi]] and Takahashi, Toshio ''The [[Suzuki Method]] for flute.'' (c.1972) * {{cite book | last = Toff | first = Nancy | coauthors = | title = The Flute Book: A Complete Guide for Students and Performers | edition=second | place = Oxford and New York | publisher = Oxford University Press | year = 1996}}
==See also== {{portal|Flutes and whistles}} * [[Method (music)]] * [[Flute]] * [[Western concert flute]] * [[Suzuki method]] * [[Music education]]
==References== {{reflist}}
